head.title: Painful Colon Disease Is Linked to Stress

hedline.hl1: Painful Colon Disease Is Linked to Stress

abstract.p: New study finds ulcerative colitis, disease in which lining of colon and rectum become inflamed, seems to be worsened by long-term stress (S)

block.p: Ulcerative colitis, a serious disease in which the lining of the colon and rectum become inflamed, causing severe pain, appears to be worsened by long-term stress, a new study has found.

Ulcerative colitis, a serious disease in which the lining of the colon and rectum become inflamed, causing severe pain, appears to be worsened by long-term stress, a new study has found.

Doctors have long theorized that stress can play a role in the disease, but have never been able to prove it, said the researchers, writing in the May issue of The American Journal of Gastroenterology.

The problem, they said, was that past research looked at short-term stress, with the expectation that a flare-up would be seen within a month or two. Instead, the researchers concluded, after examining 62 patients in Italy for six years, it is longer-term stress, measuring as long as two years, that seems to play a role.
They emphasized, though, that stress was only one factor and that no one really could explain the course of the chronic disease, which goes in and out of remission.
